class applicant.apps.ApplicantConfig(app_name, app_module)

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration class for the applicant app.

name = 'applicant'

applicant.forms module

class applicant.forms.ApplicantProfileForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)

Bases: ModelForm

Form for creating or updating an ApplicantProfile.

headline

A short headline describing the applicant.

Type:

CharField

summary

A summary of the applicant’s background and goals.

Type:

TextField

skills

The applicant’s skills.

Type:

MultipleChoiceField

resume

The applicant’s resume.

Type:

FileField

Form fields:

  • headline: Headline (CharField)

  • summary: Summary (CharField)

  • skills: Skills (ModelMultipleChoiceField)

  • resume: Resume (FileField)

property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class applicant.forms.EducationFormSet(data=None, files=None, instance=None, save_as_new=False, prefix=None, queryset=None, **kwargs)

Bases: BaseInlineFormSet

Inline formset for managing an applicant’s education history.

Based on the Education model, this formset enables adding, updating, and removing education entries linked to an ApplicantProfile.

absolute_max = 2000
can_delete = True
can_delete_extra = True
can_order = False
edit_only = False
extra = 1
fk = <django.db.models.ForeignKey: applicant_profile>
form

alias of EducationForm

max_num = 1000
min_num = 0
model

alias of Education

renderer = None
validate_max = False
validate_min = False
class applicant.forms.ExperienceFormSet(data=None, files=None, instance=None, save_as_new=False, prefix=None, queryset=None, **kwargs)

Bases: BaseInlineFormSet

Inline formset for managing an applicant’s work experience.

Based on the Experience model, it allows adding, editing, and deleting experience entries associated with an ApplicantProfile.

absolute_max = 2000
can_delete = True
can_delete_extra = True
can_order = False
edit_only = False
extra = 1
fk = <django.db.models.ForeignKey: applicant_profile>
form

alias of ExperienceForm

max_num = 1000
min_num = 0
model

alias of Experience

renderer = None
validate_max = False
validate_min = False

applicant.models module

class applicant.models.ApplicantProfile(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: BaseModel

Applicant profile model.

user

One-to-one relationship with the User model.

Type:

OneToOneField

headline

Applicant’s headline.

Type:

CharField

summary

Applicant’s summary.

Type:

TextField

skills

Many-to-many relationship with the Skill model.

Type:

ManyToManyField

experience

Many-to-many relationship with the Experience model.

Type:

ManyToManyField

education

Many-to-many relationship with the Education model.

Type:

ManyToManyField

resume

Applicant’s resume file.

Type:

FileField

Parameters:

  • id (BigAutoField) – Primary key: ID

  • created_at (DateTimeField) – Created at

  • updated_at (DateTimeField) – Updated at

  • headline (CharField) – Headline

  • summary (TextField) – Summary

  • resume (FileField) – Resume

Relationship fields:

Parameters:

  • user (OneToOneField to User) – User (related name: applicant_profile)

  • skills (ManyToManyField to Skill) – Skills (related name: applicants)

  • experience (ManyToManyField to Experience) – Experience (related name: applicantprofile)

  • education (ManyToManyField to Education) – Education (related name: applicantprofile)

Reverse relationships:

Parameters:

  • experiences (Reverse ForeignKey from Experience) – All experiences of this applicant profile (related name of applicant_profile)

  • educations (Reverse ForeignKey from Education) – All educations of this applicant profile (related name of applicant_profile)

  • applications (Reverse ForeignKey from Application) – All applications of this applicant profile (related name of applicant)

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

applications

Type: Reverse ForeignKey from Application

All applications of this applicant profile (related name of applicant)

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager

created_at

Type: DateTimeField

Created at

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this

education

Type: ManyToManyField to Education

Education (related name: applicantprofile)

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager

educations

Type: Reverse ForeignKey from Education

All educations of this applicant profile (related name of applicant_profile)

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Type: BigAutoField

Primary key: ID

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this

objects = <django.db.models.Manager object>
resume

Type: FileField

Resume

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
skills

Type: ManyToManyField to Skill

Skills (related name: applicants)

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager

User (related name: applicant_profile)

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')
user_id

Internal field, use user instead.

class applicant.models.Skill(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: BaseModel

Skill model.

name

Name of the skill.

Type:

CharField

Parameters:

  • id (BigAutoField) – Primary key: ID

  • created_at (DateTimeField) – Created at

  • updated_at (DateTimeField) – Updated at

  • name (CharField) – Name

Reverse relationships:

Parameters:

  • applicants (Reverse ManyToManyField from ApplicantProfile) – All applicants of this skill (related name of skills)

  • required_in_jobs (Reverse ManyToManyField from Job) – All required in jobs of this skill (related name of skills_required)

  • job_postings (Reverse ManyToManyField from Application) – All job postings of this skill (related name of skills)
